titleStmt.title: A suruay of London Contayning the originall, antiquity, increase, moderne estate, and description of that citie, written in the yeare 1598. by Iohn Stow citizen of London. Also an apologie (or defence) against the opinion of some men, concerning that citie, the greatnesse thereof. With an appendix, containing in Latine, Libellum de situ & nobilitate Londini: written by William Fitzstephen, in the raigne of Henry the second.
titleStmt.author: Stow, John, 1525?-1605.
Fitzstephen, William, d. 1190? Descriptio nobilissimæ civitatis Londiniæ. English. Selections.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by [John Windet for] Iohn Wolfe, printer to the honorable citie of London: and are to be sold at his shop within the Popes head Alley in Lombard street,

notesStmt.note: The work by Fitzstephen is an excerpt of: Descriptio nobilissimæ civitatis Londiniæ.
Outer sheet of quire 2H in two settings: (1) without errata on 2H10v, and 2H1r line 2 ending "whome"; or (2) with errata on 2H10v, and 2H1r line 2 ending "whom".
A variant of the edition dated 1599.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop within the Popes head Alley in Lombard street
